How to Install pptp-linux on debian

  • Home
  • debian
  • pptp-linux

Today in this tutorial, I’ll show you how you can install pptp-linux on debian with and without using the command line.

Introduction

Installing pptp-linux on debian is very easy. And with the help of this tutorial, you will be able to easily install, update and uninstall pptp-linux in just a few steps.

In this tutorial I’ll show you four methods to install pptp-linux, the methods are using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic. All these methods require you to have an active and stable internet connection and sudo permission.

Install pptp-linux Using apt

To install pptp-linux in debian using apt, you will need to run the apt update command first to get the updated list of packages from the repositories.

Copy the command given below and paste it in the command line, then press enter. If you are using the sudo command for the first time then you might also need to enter your root password.

sudo apt update

After you have updated the package list using apt, you can now install pptp-linux using the apt install command. To do that use the command given below.

sudo apt -y install pptp-linux

The installation of pptp-linux might take a little bit of time depending upon your internet connection and machine configuration.

Install pptp-linux Using apt-get

To install pptp-linux using apt-get in debian, you will need to first update the package list using the apt-get update command. Copy, paste, and enter the command given below in the command line.

sudo apt-get update

After updating the package lists, use the apt-get install command given below to install pptp-linux.

sudo apt-get -y install pptp-linux

Install pptp-linux Using Synaptic

To install pptp-linux using Synaptic you will need to first install Synaptic, you can do that by following the instructions from here. After installing synaptic follow the steps below to install pptp-linux on your debian using Synaptic.

You can open synaptic by clicking on the menu icon then searching for synaptic or you can open the command line and enter the command given below –

sudo synaptic

After synaptic opens, click on the search icon and search for pptp-linux. This will display the pptp-linux package in the package window, now to install pptp-linux, click on the checkbox that is on the left side.

Then click on Mark for Installation, this will select the pptp-linux package for installation, now to install it click on the Apply button, you will get a summary window where click on the apply button again to start the download of pptp-linux.

If the download and installation are successful then the checkmark option will turn green.

Install pptp-linux Using aptitude

To install pptp-linux on debian using aptitude, you will need to first install Aptitude in your debian. To install Aptitude follow the instructions here. Once you have aptitude installed proceed to the installation of pptp-linux.

Now you will need to first update your package lists from the repositories, use the apt update command for that, after that update the package list of aptitude using the aptitude update command.

sudo apt update sudo aptitude update

After updating the package list of aptitude, install pptp-linux using the command aptitude install pptp-linux.

sudo aptitude -y install pptp-linux

How to Upgrade pptp-linux on debian

If you want to upgrade the pptp-linux package on your debian to its latest version then here’s how you can do that using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic.

Upgrade pptp-linux using Apt & Apt-get

To upgrade pptp-linux to its latest version using apt or apt-get, you will need to open the terminal then run the sudo apt update command to update the package list, after that copy and paste the commands given below to upgrade pptp-linux.

sudo apt install --only-upgrade pptp-linux sudo apt-get install --only-upgrade pptp-linux

Upgrade pptp-linux using Aptitude

To upgrade pptp-linux using aptitude you will need to again run the update command to update the package list, use command sudo aptitude update to do that. After that run the command given below to upgrade pptp-linux.

sudo aptitude -y full-upgrade pptp-linux

Upgrade pptp-linux using Synaptic

To upgrade pptp-linux using synaptic open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or by going to the menu and searching for synaptic.

In synaptic click on the reload button, this will look for updates. After that you will need to search for pptp-linux, now right-click pptp-linux, and click on the mark for upgrade option.

Now to upgrade pptp-linux just click on the apply button, then click on the apply button again in the summary screen.

How To Uninstall pptp-linux on debian

If you want to remove and uninstall pptp-linux from your debian then here’s how you can do that. To remove just pptp-linux, you can use the command that is given below, copy the command, paste it in the command line then press enter.

sudo apt remove pptp-linux

Remove related packages, dependencies & configuration files of pptp-linux

To remove all the related packages, dependencies and configuration files of pptp-linux you can use the command given below.

sudo apt -y purge pptp-linux

Remove pptp-linux using Synaptic Package Manager

You can also uninstall pptp-linux using the synaptic package manager, first open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or search and open it directly.

After that in synaptic search for pptp-linux, right-click the pptp-linux package and click on the Mark for Complete Removal option. Now to uninstall pptp-linux click on the apply button then in summary click on apply again.

Conclusion

That is how you can install pptp-linux on debian using the command line or using the synaptic package manager. I also showed you how you can uninstall and upgrade pptp-linux using the command line or using the synaptic package manager.

If you need any help regarding the installation of pptp-linux then send me a mail at netmikoblog@gmail.com, thank you.
